content.description: This problem was named for the hot sun that hits it around lunchtime in spring and summer. Despite that it's a nice looking line and one of the harder and longer lines here. The rock is kind of chossy at the very bottom but improves as you gain height.
content.location: SDS using the obvious large flake in the center of the wall. Climb straight up using crimps and pockets.

content.description: This is a pretty crimpy line climbing the short overhang on the left side of the main face.
content.location: Near the left corner, SDS using a 3 finger dish for the LH and a crimp rail for the RH. Move the LH up to a fin of rock, then continue straight up on sharp crimps.Â

content.description: This is a detached block located at the east rim of the canyon. The rock quality is a little more variable than some of the nearby boulders but the lines are challenging. The starts on this one are also made more challenging by the bushes growing around it.
